>So said brijesh gopal on 2003-06-11 --------------------
>Assertions say =
whether the test was success or not.Is
>there any other way in JUnit where =
we can find out if
>the test case has gone succesfully or not?

If a test d=
oesn't fail, then it passes.

>(Automated....i dont want to go to the logs =
and read
>it)

The TestRunners report the failed tests after a test run. If=
 a test did not fail, then it passed.
>
>Also, if i want to generate report=
s using JUnit and
>ANT, I need to have assertions in my test class. Is
>tha=
t right?

If you want tests that do anything at all, you need assertions; o=
therwise your tests all pass.

usses pass, fail, error. It may clarify some things for you.
